plugins.name: Rumin - AI Design Reviewer and Copilot
plugins.description:
Meet Your Personal Design Assistant

Step into the future of design with the world's smartest AI powered design assistant. Built to make you extraordinarily productive, Rumin is the best way to design with AI.


❇️ Validate Design Decisions

Get one-click instant, expert feedback on everything from visual hierarchy to usability flows, eliminating blind spots in your design decisions.


❇️ Just Select a Frame -> Ask Anything

No need to describe or upload screenshots of your design — Rumin sees exactly what you see and gives instant, contextual feedback.


❇️ Personal Design Assistant

No question is too big or too small—unlock unlimited expert guidance on every facet of design, from typography and color theory to fundamental design principles and beyond.


❇️ Built within Figma

Your design assistant lives where you work—no more context switching, no extra windows, it's like having ChatGPT right inside Figma.


❇️ Contextual Content Writing

Generate tailored UX writing, headlines, and descriptions that match your design's tone and purpose.


❇️ Developer-Ready Code at Your Fingertips

Bridge the developer handoff gap with accurate code snippets generated directly from your designs.


**Note: Alpha Release — Invite-Only Access

Website: www.rumin.cloud

accepted.name: Rumin
accepted.description: The AI Copilot for Designers

plugins.tagline: AI Copilot for Figma — Analyze Designs, Chat with AI, Search the Web. All inside Figma.

plugins.name: 8pt Grid Align
plugins.description:
8pt Grid Align eliminates the tedious task of aligning designs to an 8-point grid. A simple, no-fuss solution to amplify your design workflow.

  1. Instantly snap objects and round object measurements to the 8pt grid with one click.
  2. Scale proportionally, while keeping stroke weights intact.
  3. Quickly apply preset container sizes and grid widths for common screen sizes.
  4. Use the lock ratio option for precise resizing and scaling.


If aligning to 8-point grid divisions feels like a chore, this plugin will save you time and make your layouts cleaner and more consistent.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly align and scale your designs to the 8-point grid with precision and ease.

115389.description:

plugins.name: Mock Data Generator
plugins.description:
Mock Data Generator is a Figma plugin designed to enhance the design process within Figma by allowing designers to insert realistic mock text data directly into their designs. 


This plugin provides a wide range of data categories and types that can enable you to visualize how your design elements will appear when populated with actual data. 


By using this plugin, you can create more accurate, context-relevant prototypes, to improve the overall user experience and the efficiency of your design iterations.


How to Use the Plugin


  1. Open the Plugin: Start by selecting the text layer in your Figma design that you want to replace with mock data. Then, open the Mock Data Generator plugin from the Figma plugin menu.


  1. Select Category and Data Type: Use the dropdown menus to choose the category of data (e.g., Personal Identification, Professional Information) and then select the specific type of data you need (e.g., First Name, Email Address).


  1. Insert Data: Click the "Replace Selected Text" button to insert the selected mock data into the chosen text layer. If successful, the plugin will notify you that the text has been replaced. If not, it will provide a message prompting you to make the necessary selections.


  1. Review and Iterate: Review the design with the inserted data to ensure it meets your needs. Adjust categories and data types as necessary to simulate different user scenarios and refine your design.

accepted.name: Soliudeen Ogunsola
accepted.description: Product Designer.

plugins.tagline: Generate high-quality mock text data for your Figma designs.

100786.name: Mock Data Generator

By using this plugin, you can create more accurate, context-relevant prototypes, to improve the overall user experience and the efficiency of your design iterations.


How to Use the Plugin


  1. Open the Plugin: Start by selecting the text layer in your Figma design that you want to replace with mock data. Then, open the Mock Data Generator plugin from the Figma plugin menu.


  1. Select Category and Data Type: Use the dropdown menus to choose the category of data (e.g., Personal Identification, Professional Information) and then select the specific type of data you need (e.g., First Name, Email Address).


  1. Insert Data: Click the "Replace Selected Text" button to insert the selected mock data into the chosen text layer. If successful, the plugin will notify you that the text has been replaced. If not, it will provide a message prompting you to make the necessary selections.


  1. Review and Iterate: Review the design with the inserted data to ensure it meets your needs. Adjust categories and data types as necessary to simulate different user scenarios and refine your design.
100786.tagline: Generate high-quality mock text data for your Figma designs.

plugins.name: pixelbrush
plugins.description:
Pixelbrush allows you to quickly draw, pixel by pixel. Because every pixel drawn is a square, these drawings can easily be resized, copied, and manipulated with Figma's default selection tools.


Basic undo is supported. This plugin provides an earthy palette of 6 colors by default, but users can now use their own custom palette's by creating and selecting a set of squares with colors of their choice and then pressing the "select button" in the pixelbrush interface!


Tips:

  1. If you are having trouble finding the square or the plugin behavior is unresponsive try pressing "reset"
  2. If this fails, try exiting out of the plugin and restarting it with option + command + p.
  3. rasterize large pixel art to make copying it more performant.
  4. Option + drag is a great way to create patterns.
plugins.tagline: Create and manipulate pixel art

112648.name: pixelbrush
112648.description:

Tips:

  1. If you are having trouble finding the square or the plugin behavior is unresponsive try pressing "reset"
  2. If this fails, try exiting out of the plugin and restarting it with option + command + p.
  3. rasterize large pixel art to make copying it more performant.
  4. Option + drag is a great way to create patterns.
112648.release_notes: - Added color selection button and functionality

plugins.name: AutoSpec
plugins.description:
Quickly apply focus areas in your layout, identifying roles/semantics, following WCAG rules.


In this version you can:

  • Work with multiple screens simultaneously
  • Add focus areas
  • Switch between two supported languages ​​(Portuguese and English)
  • Edit roles/semantics via JSON code


[🇧🇷] Colaboração

Este projeto de acessibilidade aplicada ao design teve a colaboração de demais pessoas, especialistas em acessibilidade e designers, na revisão das semânticas e estrutura das especificações e áreas de foco:

  • Nicola Vieira - Especialista em acessibilidade
  • Jonas de Oliveira Fernandes - Especialista em acessibilidade
  • Glauco Cardoso - UX Designer


Agradeço a todos pela contribuição impar ❤️
plugins.tagline: Build accessibility specs faster

plugins.name: Jargonator
plugins.description:
Ditch lorem ipsum forever! Jargonator uses AI to generate realistic copy to fit your designs and give it a much more accurate and professional feel. This plugin is integrated with ChatGPT and allows you to precisely control the amount of text generated, including the tone and content. Add detailed direction to the model to fine-tune your text via the settings panel. This AI-powered plugin is so quick and easy at creating realistic text, there’s no excuse to use lorem ipsum ever again!


Currently this plugin is provided for free by Savas Labs and you are not required to enter your own API key. Once the API costs exceed a certain threshold you may be required to enter your own OpenAI API key in order to continue using this plugin

accepted.name: Savas Labs
accepted.description: We design and build products that create meaningful impact

plugins.tagline: AI-powered copywriting, way better than lorem ipsum

plugins.name: Smart Reparent
plugins.description:
Use this plugin to insert nodes into an auto-layout frame as absolute-positioned children while preserving their existing position on canvas.


To use:

  1. Select the base frame and the nodes you wish to insert. Make sure the base frame is ordered behind the frames you wish to insert.
  2. Run the plugin.
  3. Profit!

plugins.name: Gridify
plugins.description:
A simple plugin for Figma that allows you to quickly and easily generate the three most common viewports and grids for each device, perfect for any design project you start from scratch.


Functionality:

•Creates viewports for the 3 main viewports, adding grid styles to each frame.

•Mobile (4 columns, type: stretch, margin: 24, gutter: 20)

•Tablet (8 columns, type: stretch, margin: 32, gutter: 30)

•Desktop (12 columns, type: center, width: 65, gutter: 30)


Contact and support:

If you have any questions, suggestions, or improvements, chat with me:

jcrocco@mindtrust.com

accepted.name: Javier Crocco
accepted.description: ⌘ Design connoisseur

plugins.tagline: Create main viewports for web design

plugins.name: Onyx ◆ Design System to Code
plugins.description:
Onyx ◆ Design System to Code


◆ Overview


Onyx is designed to simplify the workflow between design and development by automating the conversion of your Figma Design System into ready-to-use Vue components. Its ability to handle multiple selected component variants and integrate design tokens provided via the Tokens Studio for Figma plugin makes it a powerful tool for modern web development.


Onyx is a Figma plugin designed to efficiently translate Figma Design Systems into Vue components, utilizing UnoCSS utility classes. This tool targets developers and designers looking to streamline the conversion of their design systems into functional, reactive UI components directly usable in Vue projects.


Project is open source:

https://github.com/onyx-gen/onyx



◆ What It Does


  • Figma Components to Vue Components: Onyx allows users to select components within Figma and generate corresponding Vue components. Design properties are translated to UnoCSS utility classes.


  • Support for Design Tokens: The plugin integrates with Tokens Studio, another Figma plugin, to convert design tokens into CSS variables. These variables are then passed to the UnoCSS utility classes (e.g., background color design token named primary.bg.hover generates the bg-$primary.bg.hover UnoCSS utility class)


  • Multi-Variant Component Support: Users can select multiple variants of a component (such as default, hover, and focused) and Onyx will generate a single Vue component. Onyx automatically applies the correct UnoCSS variants (e.g., bg-red-600 hover:bg-red-700 focus:bg-red-800)


  • Live Preview: Onyx provides a real-time preview of the generated Vue components within Figma via an iframe. This feature ensures that components are visually and functionally in sync with the Figma design.



◆ How to Use It


  1. Select Components: Start by selecting one or multiple components within your Figma design system.
  2. Open the Onyx Figma plugin: Open the Onyx Figma plugin in Figma's plugin panel.
  3. Generate Code: Onyx automatically generates Vue components for the selected Figma components.
  4. Implement in Project: Copy the generated Vue component into your Vue project.



◆ Limitations


  • Work in Progress: As the plugin is still under development, some design properties may not convert perfectly into UnoCSS utility classes. At the moment not all design tokens types can be applied.


  • Design Compatibility: There may be limitations in how certain Figma design properties translate to UnoCSS utility classes, potentially requiring manual adjustments.
plugins.tagline: Components & Design Tokens → Vue & UnoCSS

86524.name: Onyx ◆ Design System to Code
86524.description:

plugins.name: Spagett!
plugins.description:
Spagett is here to spook you! Get ready to see Spagett everywhere.

When executing the plugin there's two possible scenarios:

1. Some layers is selected: Spagett will be added as a fill to every selected layer.
2. No layer is selected: Spagett will be added as a fill to every layer that already has a fill in the page.

(Some context https://youtu.be/uyh3C1xDT3Y)

The code for this plugin is open sourced at GitHub
https://github.com/aarongarciah/figma-spagett

Made with ❤️ by Aarón García
https://twitter.com/aarongarciah

plugins.name: IconPort – Import 1100+ SVG Icons Instantly into Figma
plugins.description:
IconPort is your ultimate SVG icon inserter plugin for Figma, designed to simplify your workflow and supercharge your design process. Whether you’re building interfaces, websites, or wireframes, IconPort gives you quick access to a massive collection of 1100+ ready-to-use vector icons, right within your Figma canvas.


⚡️ What This Plugin Does:

✅ Browse and search 1100+ clean, scalable SVG icons

✅ Instantly insert icons into your Figma file with a single click

✅ All icons are standardized at 24x24 pixels

✅ Optimized SVGs with minimal code and maximum compatibility

✅ No need to download or import manually — it’s all in Figma!


🚀 Why Designers Love IconPort:

  1. Instant access to high-quality icons without leaving Figma
  2. Smooth insertion — no bloat, just pure SVG
  3. Simple, searchable interface
  4. Perfect for design systems, wireframing, and prototyping


About Me: Hi, I'm Guru Nivash R — a Product Owner passionate about building user-focused digital experiences. I specialize in product design, usability, and workflow optimization, and I love creating tools that empower designers to work faster and smarter. Feel free to connect with me on LinkedIn or email me at guru532000@gmail.com for any queries or collaboration.

accepted.name: Guru Nivash
accepted.description: Aspiring Product Owner

plugins.tagline: IconPort is an open-source library of 1,100+ SVG icons. Free to use in all your Figma designs!

plugins.name: Responsive variables
plugins.description:
The plugin is designed to streamline the management of typography and sizing variables in responsive design projects. With this plugin, you can efficiently create and manage typography and sizing variables using standardized naming conventions and automate the creation of styles with linked variables.


Demo file https://www.figma.com/community/file/1419690653122064051/responsive-variables-demo


Key Features:


  1. Automatic Variable Creation: Generates typography or sizing variables based on a predefined naming convention.
  2. Linked Styles: Automatically creates text styles with linked variables, ensuring consistency and ease of updates.
  3. Parameter Multipliers: Manages parameters like line-height and letter-spacing using multipliers, allowing the plugin to calculate pixel dimensions.
  4. Style Guide Generation: Automatically create a style guide that's synced with all typography and spacing styles, giving you a quick overview of the design elements. This functionality will generate a new page called "Responsive variables".
  5. Used styles report (beta): This functionality allows users to generate a detailed report listing all the occurrences of different sizes used within a document, providing a comprehensive overview for analysis or optimization purposes


How it works:


  1. When the plugin starts, automatically load all local variables.
  2. The plugin automatically creates a new "Variables" collection where all the variables are stored.
  3. Every time you create a new variable, a text style is automatically created, and all the individual variables are bound to the corresponding property.
  4. Upon plugin load, the plugin generates a fileRefId variable containing a hash. This hash is used as a reference to store ordering data in the plugin’s local storage, ensuring data is kept separate for each file. If you encounter any issues, click the menu icon in the top-right corner of the plugin window and select “Reset Storage Data.”

accepted.name: Simone
accepted.description: Designer and Frontend Developer

plugins.tagline: Advanced Management of Typography Variables and Sizing for Responsive Design.

128424.name: Responsive variables
128424.description:

  4. Style Guide Generation: Automatically create a style guide that's synced with all typography and spacing styles, giving you a quick overview of the design elements. This functionality will generate a new page called "Responsive variables".
  5. Used styles report (beta): This functionality allows users to generate a detailed report listing all the occurrences of different sizes used within a document, providing a comprehensive overview for analysis or optimization purposes


How it works:


  1. When the plugin starts, automatically load all local variables.

If you encounter any issues, click the menu icon in the top-right corner of the plugin window and select “Reset Storage Data.”
128424.release_notes:
* Added an option to rename variables
* Introduced the ability to assign a spacing variable to a specific scope (applies only to new variables).
* Various bug fixes and improvements
128424.tagline: Advanced Management of Typography Variables and Sizing for Responsive Design.

plugins.name: Figaro Design System Token
plugins.description:
Figma Plugin for Exporting Variables


This Figma plugin simplifies the export of design variables (such as colors, typography, and dimensions) into a structured JSON format. It's ideal for design and development teams aiming to maintain consistency between their Figma design system and codebase.


With this plugin, you can export local variables organized into collections, including details about modes, aliases, and default values, making it easy to integrate them into development workflows like creating design tokens or style systems in CSS or JavaScript.


Features:


Export color, typography, spacing, and more from Figma to JSON.

Support for variable collections and modes (e.g., dark/light mode).

Alias management for consistent use of styles across projects.

Easy integration with development tools to use exported variables in web or mobile projects.

This plugin helps you maintain a robust and scalable design system, seamlessly syncing design variables between Figma and your code.
plugins.tagline: Export Collection Variables

102567.name: Figaro Design System Token
102567.description:
Figma Plugin for Exporting Variables

With this plugin, you can export local variables organized into collections, including details about modes, aliases, and default values, making it easy to integrate them into development workflows like creating design tokens or style systems in CSS or JavaScript.


Features:


Export color, typography, spacing, and more from Figma to JSON.

Support for variable collections and modes (e.g., dark/light mode).

Alias management for consistent use of styles across projects.

Easy integration with development tools to use exported variables in web or mobile projects.

This plugin helps you maintain a robust and scalable design system, seamlessly syncing design variables between Figma and your code.

plugins.name: MarkCraft
plugins.description:
As tools like ChatGPT, Claude, and other AI chats become an everyday part of our creative workflow, we’re constantly generating content in Markdown — ideas, research, notes, and UI copy. But bringing that content into Figma usually means losing all formatting. MarkCraft bridges that gap, turning raw Markdown into beautifully styled, editable text — so your insights look as good as your designs.


Headings, bold, italics, and lists are automatically applied using Figma’s native text features — no manual styling needed. Craft better content inside Figma — with just one click.


⚡ Key Features

Easy Edit

Convert Markdown into fully formatted Figma text — and keep editing like any native text layer.


Smart Lists

Supports clean bulleted and numbered lists (single-level only for V1).


Text Styling

Automatically applies headings, bold, italic — directly into Figma’s text nodes.


Auto Layout Friendly

Generates tidy, responsive frames ready for layout and resizing.

accepted.name: Linh Tran
accepted.description: UX Designer + Engineer

plugins.tagline: Markdown to Figma Made Effortless

130342.description:

plugins.name: Filla - Color Palette Extractor
plugins.description:
What it does

Filla dives through every nested layer; shapes, text, vectors, icons, and pulls out every unique solid and gradient fill or stroke. It then drops those colours into a neat swatch grid on-canvas, each labelled with its HEX value. One click turns the whole set into named Figma Color Styles.


How to use:

1. Select any parent frame, component, or section.

2. Run Filla → watch the deep scan.

3. Review the generated palette.

4. Hit Create Styles to add them to your library.


Why it’s handy

• Kick-start a design system by surfacing legacy colours.

• Audit messy files and spot duplicates fast.

• Hand off a clear colour spec to developers in seconds.

accepted.name: Dára Sobaloju
accepted.description: designer and craftsman

plugins.tagline: Extract every colour in any selection, auto-build a palette, and convert to Color Styles.

133579.name: Filla - Color Palette Extractor
133579.description:

How to use:

2. Run Filla → watch the deep scan.

3. Review the generated palette.

4. Hit Create Styles to add them to your library.


Why it’s handy

133579.tagline: Extract every colour in any selection, auto-build a palette, and convert to Color Styles.

plugins.name: Sunsetter
plugins.description:
Sunsetter is useful for deprecating components before publishing the next version of your design system.


  1. Supports bulk deprecation component sets and components, whether it is made of frames or auto layouts.
  2. Also supports adding your own prefix for the deprecation. If left blank, it uses the default.
  3. Deprecations can also be reversed in bulk. If a custom prefix is used, simply use the prefix and reverse.
  4. Red overlay can be turned off from more options
  5. Add notes with collects writes down deprecation notes in a separate frame
  6. Add _ to all deprecated components without changing any prefixes, just enable in more options


For feedback, please reach out to me on @amohgs

accepted.name: Amogh Srivastava
accepted.description: I love creating things that makes making other things faster

plugins.tagline: Deprecate components in a click

125046.name: Sunsetter

  4. Red overlay can be turned off from more options
  5. Add notes with collects writes down deprecation notes in a separate frame
  6. Add _ to all deprecated components without changing any prefixes, just enable in more options


For feedback, please reach out to me on @amohgs

- Added option to create a deprecation notes
- Added option to not turn off using red overlay

plugins.name: cmd-c - Generate HTML and Tailwind code
plugins.description:
cmd-c generates HTML and Tailwind code similar to your handwritten code.


It converts both Auto Layout and Absolute Positioned (Vector-Based) UI into Flex Positioned code.


cmd-c also generates semantically correct HTML by identifying the content (e.g., p, span, img, video) and interactive elements (e.g., button, a).


Our goal at cmd-c is to create the best developer handoff tool, allowing developers to focus on building what truly matters.

plugins.name: 暗色组件助手 Dark Mode Assistant for Components
plugins.description:
介绍

“暗色组件助手”插件旨在简化在 Figma 组件中管理暗黑模式的过程。通过几次点击，你可以快速启用任何选中组件或实例的暗黑模式，同时如果可用，插件会应用组件库中的暗色 token 设置。


功能说明

  1. 自动检测并启用选中组件和实例的暗黑模式。
  2. 递归检查并更新嵌套在组和框架中的所有组件的暗黑模式。
  3. 允许你将组件库中的“暗色” token 应用于外观模块。
  4. 与具有“componentProperties”和“appearance”模块的组件兼容。


使用方法

  1. 选中你希望应用暗黑模式的组件、组或框架。
  2. 点击插件按钮，插件会自动为所有选中的元素及其子元素启用暗黑模式。
  3. 插件会自动应用暗黑模式设置，并在可用的情况下将其链接到组件库中的“暗色”token。


注意事项

  1. 插件最佳工作效果是在具有属性定义的组件库中使用。
  2. 如果未找到“appearance”模块，插件仍然会启用暗黑模式，但不会应用 token。
  3. 确保你的组件已正确链接到包含暗黑模式 token 的组件库，以获得完整功能。


Introduction

The "Dark Mode Assistant for Components" plugin is designed to streamline the process of managing dark mode properties in Figma components. With just a few clicks, you can quickly enable dark mode for any selected component or instance, while also applying the appropriate token settings for dark mode if available.


Function Description

  1. Automatically detects and enables dark mode for selected components and instances.
  2. Recursively checks and updates dark mode for all nested components within groups and frames.
  3. Allows you to apply the "dark" token from your component library's appearance module.
  4. Works seamlessly with components that have "componentProperties" and "appearance" modules.


How to Use

  1. Select the components, groups, or frames that you want to apply dark mode to.
  2. Click the plugin button to enable dark mode for all selected elements and their children.
  3. The plugin will automatically apply the dark mode setting and, if available, link it to the "dark" token in your component library.


Precautions

  1. The plugin works best with components that have properties defined in the component library.
  2. If no "appearance" module is found, the plugin will still enable dark mode but will not apply the token.
  3. Ensure that your components are correctly linked to a component library with dark mode tokens for full functionality.

accepted.name: KingweiCheung
accepted.description: If you have any questions or suggestions, feel free to contact me at kingweichueng@qq.com.

plugins.tagline: Dark Mode Assistant for Components: Easily Toggle Dark Mode

136390.name: 暗色组件助手 Dark Mode Assistant for Components

  4. 与具有“componentProperties”和“appearance”模块的组件兼容。


使用方法

  2. 点击插件按钮，插件会自动为所有选中的元素及其子元素启用暗黑模式。
  3. 插件会自动应用暗黑模式设置，并在可用的情况下将其链接到组件库中的“暗色”token。


注意事项

  2. 如果未找到“appearance”模块，插件仍然会启用暗黑模式，但不会应用 token。
  3. 确保你的组件已正确链接到包含暗黑模式 token 的组件库，以获得完整功能。


Introduction

The "Dark Mode Assistant for Components" plugin is designed to streamline the process of managing dark mode properties in Figma components. With just a few clicks, you can quickly enable dark mode for any selected component or instance, while also applying the appropriate token settings for dark mode if available.


Function Description

  1. Automatically detects and enables dark mode for selected components and instances.
  2. Recursively checks and updates dark mode for all nested components within groups and frames.
  3. Allows you to apply the "dark" token from your component library's appearance module.
  4. Works seamlessly with components that have "componentProperties" and "appearance" modules.


How to Use

  1. Select the components, groups, or frames that you want to apply dark mode to.
  2. Click the plugin button to enable dark mode for all selected elements and their children.
  3. The plugin will automatically apply the dark mode setting and, if available, link it to the "dark" token in your component library.


Precautions

  1. The plugin works best with components that have properties defined in the component library.
  2. If no "appearance" module is found, the plugin will still enable dark mode but will not apply the token.
  3. Ensure that your components are correctly linked to a component library with dark mode tokens for full functionality.

plugins.name: Spacing Manager
plugins.description:
Spacing Manager is a powerful yet intuitive plugin for Figma designed to help you efficiently find and update spacing values in your designs. Whether you want to align elements to your design system variables or apply custom spacing, Spacing Manager streamlines the process, saving you time and ensuring consistency across your projects.


✨ Key Features:

🔍 Quickly search for elements with specific spacing values.

📏 Replace spacing values with predefined design system variables or custom values.

🌙 Interactive UI with smooth dark mode and gradient accents for an enhanced user experience.

🚀 Seamless integration with your Figma projects, no setup required.


Take control of your design system spacing and ensure pixel-perfect alignment with Spacing Manager

plugins.name: Cloudinary
plugins.description:
Enhance team collaboration, streamline your workflows, and leverage Cloudinary’s powerful media management features for your Figma assets.

The Cloudinary plugin integrates directly within Figma, allowing users to effortlessly insert images from the Cloudinary Media Library and upload images to Figma to share with others.


To get started:

  1. Sign up for a free Cloudinary account.
  2. Install the Cloudinary plugin from this marketplace page.
  3. In Figma, select Cloudinary from the Plugin menu to open the interface and log in.
  4. Choose a layer or artboard, then:
  5. Use the Library tab to insert images from Cloudinary into Figma.
  6. Use the Upload tab to upload images from Figma to Cloudinary.
plugins.tagline: Use Cloudinary images and videos in Figma

130782.name: Cloudinary
130782.description:
Enhance team collaboration, streamline your workflows, and leverage Cloudinary’s powerful media management features for your Figma assets.

The Cloudinary plugin integrates directly within Figma, allowing users to effortlessly insert images from the Cloudinary Media Library and upload images to Figma to share with others.


To get started:

  1. Sign up for a free Cloudinary account.
  2. Install the Cloudinary plugin from this marketplace page.
  3. In Figma, select Cloudinary from the Plugin menu to open the interface and log in.
  4. Choose a layer or artboard, then:
  5. Use the Library tab to insert images from Cloudinary into Figma.
  6. Use the Upload tab to upload images from Figma to Cloudinary.

Continue until you have all of the stickies you need! You can also customize the color of your group of sticky notes.

Continue until you have all of the stickies you need! You can also customize the color of your group of sticky notes.

plugins.name: Keywords Generator
plugins.description:
Say goodbye to the daunting task of manually creating keywords for each component. With the AI-powered Keywords Generator plugin, you can instantly generate keywords for all your components.


How it works

Under the hood, the plugin generates a list of keywords that are synonym and closely related to the component title.


How to use

  1. Enter a valid OpenAI API key and click on "Validate Key". If successful, you'll be taken to the logged area.
  2. Select all components you wish to generate keywords for the description field (make sure you select the parent components)
  3. Select the keywords amounts and language
  4. Click on ”Generate Keywords” and wait until you see a success alert displayed


Note

  1. Please bear in mind that this plugin leverages an AI large language model, which may generate unexpected results or hallucinations. Leave a comment if you encounter unexpected outcomes or spot bugs
  2. You'll need an OpenAI API key with credit balance in order to use this plugin. Probably you won't ever use more than $0.10 in credit
  3. The time taken to generate the keywords will vary significantly depending on the amount of components selected


Ideas & Suggestions

This is a very first version and there's a lot to improve. I’d love to hear ideas and feature suggestions to continuously improve this plugin.
plugins.tagline: Instantly generate AI-powered keywords for all your Figma components.

105664.name: Keywords Generator
105664.description:
Say goodbye to the daunting task of manually creating keywords for each component. With the AI-powered Keywords Generator plugin, you can instantly generate keywords for all your components.


How it works

Under the hood, the plugin generates a list of keywords that are synonym and closely related to the component title.


How to use

  1. Enter a valid OpenAI API key and click on "Validate Key". If successful, you'll be taken to the logged area.
  2. Select all components you wish to generate keywords for the description field (make sure you select the parent components)
  3. Select the keywords amounts and language
  4. Click on ”Generate Keywords” and wait until you see a success alert displayed


Note

  1. Please bear in mind that this plugin leverages an AI large language model, which may generate unexpected results or hallucinations. Leave a comment if you encounter unexpected outcomes or spot bugs
  2. You'll need an OpenAI API key with credit balance in order to use this plugin. Probably you won't ever use more than $0.10 in credit
  3. The time taken to generate the keywords will vary significantly depending on the amount of components selected


Ideas & Suggestions

This is a very first version and there's a lot to improve. I’d love to hear ideas and feature suggestions to continuously improve this plugin.
105664.release_notes: • Added plugin UI colors to work on Light Mode
105664.tagline: Instantly generate AI-powered keywords for all your Figma components.

plugins.name: ZEIT Online Content Grabber
plugins.description:
This plugin populates your designs with content from Zeit Online.


After providing an url to any article, this plugin will pull in content (images and text) from zeit.de. Currently only articles are supported and will populate the following data.

@image

@kicker

@headline

@description

@author

@commentCount


In Figma name your layers accordingly for the plugin to do its work.

plugins.name: UserPop – Random People Generator
plugins.description:
UserPop – Random People Generator

A simple, powerful Figma plugin that generates random user profiles with realistic data — perfect for designers, developers, and teams who need high-quality placeholder content for mockups and prototypes.


🔑 Key Features:

One-Click Generation

Instantly generate full user profiles with a single click — no setup required.


Complete User Data

Includes:


Profile pictures (in 3 sizes)


Name, age, and gender


Email, phone, and full address


Login credentials (username & password)


Clean, User-Friendly Interface


Minimal and organized layout


Easy-to-read content


Clickable profile images


Rotating ad banners (optional)


Smart Data Persistence


Automatically remembers the last generated user


Reloads the previous profile when the plugin is reopened


🎯 Perfect For:

UI/UX Designers


Web & App Developers


Design System Creators


Anyone needing quick, realistic user content for mockups

plugins.name: Image Text Extractor (AI)
plugins.description:
Simply select any image layer or frame, click "Extract Text," and watch as the plugin captures all visible text while preserving line breaks and formatting.


Add extracted text directly to your Figma designs with a single click - either as a single element or separated by line breaks.


Unlike other OCR solutions, our plugin works entirely within Figma, eliminating the need to switch between apps or use external services.


Powered by Google's Gemini 1.5 Flash model, it delivers superior accuracy with support for multiple languages and complex layouts.


Perfect for designers working with client mockups, UI screenshots, or any design asset containing text that needs to be extracted and edited.

accepted.name: Pravin M Singh
accepted.description: I design, code, sing, dance, make love, cook food and do soul things

plugins.tagline: Extract Text from Images using Vision AI

plugins.name: Curly Arrows
plugins.description:
Curly Arrows - Point with Personality!


Add playful motion and hand-drawn charm to your Figma designs with Curly Arrows, a collection of quirky, artistic arrows.


Whether you're sketching a quick flow, highlighting key elements, or just adding some fun, these swishy arrows keep things clear and creative.


Pick your favorite color, adjust the stroke width, and make each arrow your own.


🖤 Open-source & community-driven! Check out the code or contribute: https://github.com/ko-ko-lo/figma-art-arrows

accepted.name: Denise Kolodzey
accepted.description:
👋 Hi! 
I’m a UX Engineer with a love for thoughtful tools and beautiful details.
I build Figma plugins that make workflows smoother and design more fun.

plugins.name: Pixel Magic
plugins.description:
Transform your images into eye-catching pixel art with Pixel, the ultimate Figma plugin for pixel enthusiasts! Whether you're crafting retro aesthetics or exploring unique design styles, Pixie offers endless possibilities for creativity.


Why Use Pixel Pixie?

  1. Custom Backgrounds: Set your own background color to complement your design perfectly.
  2. Adjustable Precision: Control size for the ideal level of detail in your artwork.
  3. Pixel Shapes: Choose from various pixel shapes (squares, circles, and semi-circle) to customize your pixel art style.
  4. Export Type: Choose to export the pixelated effect as either an image or a group of nodes.


Designed for designers, artists, and creative minds, Pixie lets you reimagine your visuals in stunning pixelated forms. Discover how this versatile plugin can bring a bold new dimension to your designs.


Important Note:

  1. For node based export, the time to export depends based on number of nodes.
  2. It is better to not have huge number of nodes for better performance


Feedback & Support:

I'd love to see what you've created using this plugin! Feel free to tag me or say hi on X/Twitter (@HarshithAshvi). Your feedback and bug reports are always welcome 🙏


Contact:

Email: astroashvi@gmail.com

X/Twitter: https://x.com/HarshithAshvi
